A record 147 homicides occur in Columbus in 2017.
Senator Al Franken resigns after allegations of sexual abuse against women emerge.
ECOT, the Electronic Classroom of Tomorrow is closed by its board. It owes the state of Ohio $80,000,000 for students it claimed it had but rarely logged in to the online school.
The United States government enters a federal government shutdown as a result of a dispute over Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals.
Adobe PhoneGap 8.0.0 released
SpaceX Launches the first Falcon 9 Heavy rocket. It sends Elon Musk's red Tesla roadster into a solar orbit beyond Mars and back.
Docker 1.19 released
The Home Pod speaker is released by Apple.
The 2018 Winter Olympics are held in Pyeongchang, South Korea.

Westerville police Officers Eric Joering and Anthony Morelli are shot and killed in an exchange of gunfire as they entered his townhouse in the 300 block of Cross Wind Drive to investigate a 911 hang-up call.
Sony Pictures Animation releases Peter Rabbit. $351,266,433
repo: George starts work on the OCLC Node Authentication Library
Jacob Zuma resigns as President of South Africa after nine years in power.
The Ohio River at Cincinnati crested at 60.53 feet. This makes it the 22nd highest river crest on record with the United States Geological Survey.
Spring Boot 2.0 released.
BitCoin closes above $10,000.
President of the United States Donald Trump accepts an invitation from North Korean leader Kim Jong-un for a meeting in May to discuss the denuclearisation of North Korea.

China's government approves a constitutional change that removes term limits for its leaders, granting Xi Jinping the status of "President for Life". Xi is also the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China (paramount leader).

Democrat Conor Lamb defeats Republican Rick Soccone in a special election for the House of Representatives in a district south of Pittsburgh that Trump won by 20 points in the 2016 presidential election.

In response to gun violence in the United States, and particularly triggered by the Stoneman Douglas High School shooting in Parkland, Florida, thousands of high school students across the country participate in an organized protest they called the National School Walkout.
USS Colorado SSN-788 commissioned.
In Tempe, Arizona, a self driving car operated by Uber killed a woman walking a bicycle across the street. The safety driver was watching a movie on her phone.
Docker 1.20 released
Java SE 10 general availability.
Alexander Nix, the CEO of Cambridge Analytica, the firm at the heart of the data-mining scandal, has been suspended after video leaked of him describing illegal activity.
Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+ released.
Mark Zuckerberg apologizes on T.V. for the Cambridge Analytica data breach. The account data of 50,000,000 users was used by Cambridge Analytica to influence the Brexit and Trump election wins.
John Bolton replaces H.R. McMaster as national security advisor.
President Trump announces $60 billion in trade tariffs against China.

Quentin L. Smith is is charged with killing Westerville police Officers Eric Joering and Anthony Morelli on Feb. 10 in an exchange of gunfire as they entered his townhouse in the 300 block of Cross Wind Drive to investigate a 911 hang-up call.
In over 900 cities internationally, people participate in demonstrations against gun violence and mass shootings, calling for stronger gun control in the "March for Our Lives".
More than 100 Russian diplomats are expelled by more than 20 countries in the wake of the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal.
An appeals court said on Tuesday that Google violated copyright laws when it used Oracle's open-source Java software to build the Android platform in 2009.
iOS 11.3 released by Apple.
Tiangong-1 burns up over the Pacific. China had lost control of the unmanned station

Former Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva is given an arrest warrant after a vote by the Supreme Court voted 6–5 in favor of denying his habeas corpus, due to corruption and other scandals.

Mark Zuckerberg testifies before congress. The Facebook CEO, who has built his billionaire fortune by harvesting and selling our data, dodged questions and stuck to his carefully coached talking points.
Docker 1.21 released
House Speaker Paul Ryan announces he won't seek reelection since Republicans are certain to lose the House in November, and because he cannot contain President Trump's damage to the GOP.
Google Chrome v68.

A series of thunderstorms produced record-breaking rainfall on the Hawaiian Islands of Kauaʻi and Oahu. The heaviest rainfall occurred on northern Kauaʻi. There, a rain gauge owned by the Waipā Foundation, just west of Hanalei, recorded 49.69 in (1,262 mm) of rainfall in the 24 hours between 12:45 p.m. on April 14 and 15. This was the greatest 24-hour rainfall total on record in the United States
NASA's Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) is launched.
A vehicle-ramming attack kills 10 people and injures 16 in Toronto. A 25-year-old suspect, Alek Minassian, is arrested.
NodeJS 10 released.
Ford announces it is exiting the business of making sedans in the United States. Fiesta, Fusion, Taurus, and C-Max van are discontinued. Mustang and a new Focus crossover will remain in production.

Ohio House of Representatives Speaker Cliff Rosenberger resigns after admitting that the FBI is investigating payments he took from the PayDay lending industry and others with business before the legislature.
Kim Jong-un crosses into South Korea to meet with President Moon Jae-in, becoming the first North Korean leader to cross the Demilitarized Zone since its creation in 1953.
Newly appointed Trump lawyer Rudy Giuliani says that Trump reimbursed Cohen for paying $130K to porn star Stormy Daniels, setting off a firestorm.
Lava began erupting from new fissures in the Kilauea Volcano's Lower East Rift Zone, sending flows of  molten rock through entire communities on the southeastern corner of the Big Island of Hawaii.
The Mars Insight lander is launched towards Mars on an Atlas V rocket.
President Donald Trump announced Tuesday he is quitting the Iran nuclear deal, pitting him against the United States' closest allies and leaving the future of Tehran's nuclear ambitions in question.

A state audit released Thursday says the Electronic Classroom of Tomorrow (ECOT) purposely inflated the amount of time it claimed its students were engaged in learning, leading the now-closed online school to receive more money than it deserved from the state.
Two Russian TU-95 "Bear" bombers were intercepted by US F-22 stealth fighters in international airspace off the coast of Alaska.
The wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle is held at St George's Chapel, England, with an estimated global audience of 1.9 billion.
Kelly's first day at T-Cetera
Cycling: Longest bike ride. 37 miles, Olentangy Trail, West Side Casino
Ellicott City, Maryland outside of Baltimore is devestated by flash flooding, the second time in two years.
Alex and Zach march in the Worthington Memorial Day parade with new Sousaphones and a new Baritone Saxaphone. It is very hot!
Subtropical Storm Alberto made landfall in the afternoon near Laguna Beach, Florida, on the northern Gulf Coast, according to the National Hurricane Center.
Roseanne Barr's show is dropped by ABC after she goes on a racist tweet storm. She later blames the sleeping pill Ambien.
iOS 11.4 released by Apple.
Car2Go is leaving Columbus, citing slow adoption of the car-sharing service that launched here more than four years ago.
The wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle is held at St George's Chapel, England, with an estimated global audience of 1.9 billion.
Apple 2018 World Wide Developer's Conference.
Last contact with the Mars Opportunity Rover
The United States announces it will withdraw from the United Nations Human Rights Council.
Intel announces that Cannon Lake based on 10 nanometer technology is delayed until 2019 due to technical problems.
Saudi Arabia allows women to drive.
Javascript ECMAScript 2018 released.
Former Aum Shinrikyo leader Shoko Asahara and six other main members of Aum Shinrikyo, who led the 1995 Tokyo subway sarin attack, are executed by hanging.
Apple releases new MacBook Pros with 6 core I9 processors, 32 GB of ram and up to 4 TB of SSD. A membrane is added under the keyboard to dampen noise and keep dust out. Siri can listen all the time.
Heavy wildfires in Greece leave 87 dead and more than a hundred buildings destroyed.

The share price of Facebook drops by almost 20 percent after the company warns investors that user growth has slowed following the data leak scandal. Over $109 billion is wiped from its market value, the largest single day loss in corporate history.
Apple becomes the first company to have a market capitalization exceeding one trillion dollars.
The United States reimposes sanctions on Iran.
George attends Docker training.
NASA launches the Parker Solar Probe.
Part of the Morandi Bridge collapses after a violent storm in Genoa, Italy, causing 43 fatalities.
Paul Manafort, Trump’s Former Campaign Chairman, Guilty of 8 Counts

Michael Cohen, President Donald Trump's former personal lawyer and fixer, pleads guilty to campaign-finance violations and other charges, saying Trump directed him to arrange the payment of hush money to porn star Stormy Daniels and a former Playboy model to fend off damage to his White House bid.
Senator John McCain dies.

The City of Columbus sets regulations for scooters and other shared-mobility devices. Up to 8 compainies are allowed to have up to 500 each. Companies must pay $500 plus $75 per scooter to license them. Scooters may not exceed 15 mph. Devices parked in the same spot for more than 7 days can result in a $300 fine.
A fire destroys the National Museum of Brazil in Rio de Janeiro.
Visit Air Force Museum
Hurricane Florence hits near Wilmington, North Carolina. The slow moving category 2 storm brings storm surges and heavy rain.
Last Delta II Launch - Ice, Cloud and land Elevation Satellite-2.
iOS 12 released by Apple
The Dow Jones Industrial Average peaks at 26,697.
Apple releases the iPhone XS and iPhone XS Max.
MacOS 10.14 Mojave released by Apple.
Java 11 released.
A magnitude 7.5 earthquake hits Sulawesi, Indonesia, causing a tsunami that kills at least 2,256 people and injures more than 10,679 others.
USS Indiana SSN-789 commissioned.
Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi is murdered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, triggering a diplomatic crisis for Saudi Arabia.
The Dow peaks at 26,828.

The Parker Solar Probe successfully performed the first of the seven planned Venus flybys, where it came within about 1,500 miles (2,400 km) of Venus in order to reduce the probe's speed and orbit closer to the Sun.
Canon Releases the EOS-R, an expensive mirrorless camera body that uses the EF-R lens mount.

Hurricane Michael makes landfall as a Category 4 (upgraded to a 5 in April, 2019), destroying Mexico Beach, FL and Tyndall Air Force Base. Large portions of the panhandle region are wihout power for weeks. The fast moving storm is still Cat 3 when it enters Georgia, destroying billions in crops. Flooding occurs in Georgia, North and South Carolina, and Virginia.
Canada legalises the sale and use of cannabis, becoming the second country in the world to do so, after Uruguay in 2013.
Gerald Lawson III, 31, is sentenced to 5 years in prison for acting as a straw buyer for Quentin L. Smith. The gun Lawson provided was used to kill two Westerville police officers in February, 2018.
The unmanned European-Japanese spacecraft BepiColombo is launched on a seven-year journey to Mercury.
The Hong Kong–Zhuhai–Macau Bridge, the world's longest sea crossing bridge, is opened by Chinese President Xi Jinping
Apple releases the iPhone XR.
Cesar Sayoc, a die hard Trump supporter, is arrested in Florida for mailing pipe bombs to 10 prominent Trump Administration critics.
The new Veterans Memorial opens downtown.
Robert D. Bowers kills 11 people, mostly elderly, in a Synagog in Pittsburgh.
Lion Air Flight 610, a Boeing 737 MAX, crashed into the Java Sea twelve minutes after takeoff with 189 passengers and crew.
The Parker Solar Probe becomes the closest man made object to the sun when it came within 26,000,000 miles.
Apple introduces Apple Pencil 2 for the third generation iPad Pro.
NASA's Dawn mission concludes after it runs out of hydrazine fuel.

The "Camp Fire" in California starts. By the morning of November 13 the fire, fueled by strong winds, caused 48 civilian fatalities, injured 3 firefighters, covered an area of about 135,000 acres (55,000 ha), and either damaged or destroyed at least 8,817 structures, with most of the damage occurring within the first two days of the fire.
Illumination Animation releases Dr. Suess The Grinch. $511 million
Amazon Picks Long Island City, Queens, New York City and Crystal City, Northern Virginia for its HQ2, ending a yearlong search that involved 238 cities.

The New York Times reports that Facebook hired a Republican lobbying firm to plant fake news stories blaming Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election on George Soros. In October 2017, Facebook also expanded its work with a Washington-based consultant, Definers Public Affairs, that had originally been hired to monitor press coverage of the company.
The ARA San Juan, an Argentinian submarine, is found 900m below the surface, imploded and spread across a 70m debris field. 44 crew members were lost.
BitCoin closes above $5,000.
George & Kelly visit Sugar Creek.
Mars Insight lands on Mars.

General Motors announces it is ending production of the Chevy Impala, Chevy Cruze, Chevy Volt, Buick LaCrosse, Cadillac XTS and Cadillac CT6. Plants in Oshawa, Ontario; Detroit, Michigan; and Warren, Ohio (Lordstown) will be closed in 2019, and 15,000 workers layed off.
Ukrainian crisis: Ukraine declares martial law after an armed incident in which Russia seized three Ukrainian ships in the disputed Kerch Strait two days earlier
A magnitude 7.0 earthquake strikes near Anchorage, Alaska. No deaths are reports, but there is severe damage to infrastructure.
Tesla Motors achieves a Model 3 production rate of 1000 vehicles per day. It's unclear if this "burst rate" is sustainable.

France experiences its worst civil unrest since the protests of 1968 due to the yellow vests movement. Protests in Paris morph into riots, with hundreds of people injured and thousands arrested; over 100 cars are burned, the Arc de Triomphe is vandalized and numerous other tourist sites are closed, both in the capital and elsewhere in the country.
NASA reports the arrival of the OSIRIS-REx probe at Bennu, the agency's first sample-return mission to an asteroid.

James Alex Fields, Jr. is convicted of first degree murder for plowing his 2010 Dodge Challenger into a crowd during a White Supremecists rally in Charlotte, North Carolina, killing 32-year-old paralegal Heather Heyer. A jury in Charlottesville deliberated for seven hours before convicting Fields, 21, a Nazi sympathizer from Maumee, Ohio.
John Kelly resigns as Trump's Chief of Staff. Kelly and Trump stopped speaking to each other weeks ago.

President Trump meets with Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Speaker Delegate Nancy Pelosi in the White House. In a public discussion, Trump threatens to shut down the government until he gets 5.5 billion dollars.
Michael Cohen, President Trump's former personal lawyer, is sentenced to 3 years in prison.
Bitcoin bottoms at $3,183.
Virgin Galactic Spaceship Two completes a successful flight to 51 miles in altitude at Mach 2.9. It is the first space flight since a previous Spaceship Two was lost in 2014.
At the Katowice Climate Change Conference, nearly 200 nations agree rules on implementing the 2015 Paris agreement. The American delegation announces a plan to increase coal use.
Luminary night. Lots of neighbors stop by to visit.
USS Delaware SSN-791 is launched.
President Trump declares victory over ISIS and announces all 2000 troops in Syria will be withdrawn. He also announces 1/2 of the troops in Afghanistan, 8000, will be withdrawn as well.
Defense Secretary James Mattis will resign at the end of February, he informed President Trump in a letter Thursday.
A tsunami hits Sunda Strait, Indonesia, killing at least 430 people and injuring nearly 1,500.

Trump refuses to sign a spending bill that does not include $5.5 billion for 100 miles of his southern border wall. The government shuts down and many federal workers are furloughed or forced to work without pay.
Annoyed by Defense Secretary James Mattis's resignation letter, Trump forces him to leave on January 1st.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average plunges 650 points to 21,792 after Treasury Secretary Mnuchin inexplicably calls major bank CEO's to reassure them about liquidity and announces he is convening the "plunge protection team". Meanwhile, Trump explores if he can fire Federal Reserve Chief Jerome Powell, whom he accuses of raising interest rates and destroying the stock market.
Sears announces it is closing its last two remaining Columbus stores, at Tuttle Mall and Polaris Fashion Place.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average closes at 23,327, down 3,370 points since its peak on September 20th.
There are 103 homicides in Columbus in 2018.
All time precipitation record in Columbus of 55.63".

The DOW falls 611 points after Apple announces that the trade war has slowed the Chinese economy and demand for its products "more than expected". Apple revises it's revenue for 1Q 2019 from 89-93 billion on November 7th, 2018 to 84 billion dollars on January 2, 2019.
Nancy Pelosi is sworn in as Speaker of the House. She says that President Trump is not immune from prosecution "I think that that is an open discussion in terms of the law."
Kelly interviews with HMS Healthcare and they make an offer the same day!
First significant snow of the winter. Zach and Finn make $60 shoveling driveways.
The Parker Solar Probe reached its first aphelion, thus completing its first full orbit.
President Trump agrees to reopen the government for 3 weeks after unpaid air traffic controllers call in sick and air travel delays explode. He does not get funding for his border wall.
A mining tailing dam collapses in Brazil, in the Córrego do Feijão mine in the southeastern state of Minas Gerais, killing hundreds of people.
Temperature falls to -9 in Ohio as a polar vortex sweeps across Ohio.
Alex performs in the All State Band at the Cleveland Convention Center.
USS South Dakota SSN-790 commissioned.
Kelly starts new job at HMS Healthcare.
Vue.js 2.6.0 released
Kelly gets her last paycheck from T-Cetra.
President Trump declares a national emergency to fund his border wall after negotiations with congress fail to fund the project.
Kelly gets her first paycheck from HMS Healthcare.
60 mph wind gusts associated with a cold front knock a pine tree onto Susan Keeler's house, crushing her car port and damaging her Subaru.
Visit Air Force Museum

President Trump walks away from a summit with Kim Jong Un in Hanoi after Un demands lifting sanctions in exchange for shuttering a few nuclear sites, instead of giving up his estimated 60 nuclear weapons.
SpaceX launches an unmanned DragonX capsule to the International Space Station.
An unmanned DragonX capsule successfully docks with the International Space Station for the first time.
Tornados kill 23 in Alabama and Georgia.
The last Chevy Cruz rolls off the assembly line at the Lordstown Plant near Toledo.
Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302, a Boeing 737 MAX, crashed six minutes after takeoff with 157 passengers and crew.
Ethiopian Airlines grounds all of its Boeing 737 MAX aircraft.
China grounds all Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft.
The United States grounds all Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft. The worldwide fleet of 387 aircraft is grounded.

A mid latitude cyclone rapidly intensifies over the upper midwest, dropping heavy snow, and later warm rain that will result in massive and historic flooding in Nebraska, Iowa and Wisconsin along the Elkhorn and Missouri rivers. Record low pressure is recorded at Pueblo, Colorado.
In the case of the stolen NSA cyber weapons, including Eternal Blue, Harold T. Martin III plead guilty to willful retention of national defense information and was sentenced to 9 years in prison.
Offut Airforce Base, south of Omaha, Nebraska is severely damaged by record flooding.
Java 12 released.

The Department of Transportation requested the Office of Inspector General to conduct an audit on the Boeing 737 MAX certification process and Congress also announced an investigation into the same process.
Robert Mueller turns in his final report on Russian meddling in the 2016 presedential election to Attorney General William Barr. There are no indictments of Trump or his inner circle.
Apache Cordova 9.0.0 released
Attorney General Barr releases a four page summary to congress of the Mueller report, claiming there was no collusion between Trump and Russia in the 2016 campaign.
We report to work in the Smith "Swing Space". We will be there for 8 months while the 4th floor of the Kilgour Building is renovated.
Apple cancels the AirPower charging mat.

The rebuit Oroville Dam spillway is used for the first time. Lake Oroville is 81% full and a large snowpack is expected to increase inflows. Initial flows are limited to 20,000 CFS, with increases to 60,000 CFS later in the week.
SpaceX launches the Falcon Heavy for the second time, placing the 16,000 lb Arabsat 6 into geosynchronous orbit.
Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris burns.
The redacted Mueller Report is released to the public by Attorney General William Barr.
An armed group calling itself the United Constitutional Patriots detained nearly 300 people near Sunland Park, New Mexico.
GoFundMe and PayPal cut off the United Constitutional Patriots
Yellow Vest protestors set fires in Paris to protest the 1 billion euros raised to repair Notre Dame Cathedral while the "miserables" are ignored by the rich.
United Constitutional Patriots founder Larry Mitchell Hopkins was taken into custody by FBI agents for being a convicted felon in possession of firearms and ammunition
Sri Lanka Bombing - 207 people are killed in 8 separate, coordinated bombings in Sri Lankan Christian churches and hotels during Easter Sunday services.
The DOW peaks at 26,656, it's highest value since the 12/14/2018 plunge.
OCLC stops work on Listio.

US - China trade talks collapse. Trump increases tariffs on $200 billion in Chinese goods from 10% to 25%. For the week, the S&P 500 drops 2.2%, the worse week of losses in 2019. The DOW is at 25,679.

Four oil tankers in the Emirati port of Fujairah suffered damage from what appeared to be limpet mines or a similar explosive device. An investigation by the UAE, Norway, and Saudi Arabia concluded that limpet mines were placed on oil tankers to explode as a part of a sophisticated sabotage operation.

An estimated 21 tornadoes touched down during a series of storms late Memorial Day into early Tuesday morning across Ohio. Damage included an apartment complex in Trotwood, Ohio. A tornado near West Milton in southern Miami County was classified as an EF2 on the Enhanced Fujita scale, with wind speeds of between 111 and 135 mph. It is the most active tornado period in Ohio since July, 1992. Insured damages were $480,000,000.
China tells its people to prepare for a long trade war, and announces restrictions on rare earth metals.
Trump announces a 5% tariff on all Mexican goods to punish Mexico for letting illegal immigrants into the United States.
Trump announces the tariffs are cancelled because Mexico will deploy national guard troops to control immigration. The DOW immediately begins a 1300 point rise.
Illumination Animation releases The Secret Life of Pets 2. $433 million

The National Weather Service replaces the 40 year old Global Forecast Model with a finite volume algorithm called FV3. It should improve forecasts, most notably of hurricane tracks. The algorithm takes advantage of 8.6 Petaflops of computing power.

In the Straights of Hormuz, two oil tankers are damaged by explosions, setting one on fire. U.S. Secretary of State Pompeo blames Iran. Supposedly the military has video of an Iranian ship removing an unexploded limpet mine from the side of one of the stricken vessels.
Torrential rainfall of 3.25" floods North Selby Blvd. near Forest.

Iran shoots down an a U.S. Navy drone in the Straights of Hormuz. The U.S. claims it was over international waters while Iran claimed it was over Iranian airspace. It is believed that factions in Iran acted independantly of President Hassan Rouhani and Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei.

President Trump orders a retaliatory attack on Iranian missile and radar sites, but calls off the attack 10 minutes before bombs were to be dropped and missiles fired. He say the 150 Iranian lives that yould have been lost would not have been proportionate to the drone shootdown.
The Raspberry Pi 4 is released.

President Trump tweets "Iran’s very ignorant and insulting statement, put out today, only shows that they do not understand reality. Any attack by Iran on anything American will be met with great and overwhelming force. In some areas, overwhelming will mean obliteration. No more John Kerry & Obama!"
President Trump tightens sanctions on Iran, blocking its leaders from access to the world financial systems.

A new software problem is found in the troubled Boeing 737 Max that could push the plane’s nose down automatically, and fixing the flaw is almost certain to further delay the plane’s return to flying after two deadly crashes. The FAA “identified an additional requirement” for software changes that the aircraft manufacturer has been working on for eight months, since shortly after the first crash.
Ford shuts down 5 plants in Europe (3 in Russia, 1 in France and 1 in Britain),  and lays off 12,000 workers.
Jony Ive leaves Apple to start his own design firm, as design becomes less important than services to the tech giant.
President Trump meets with Chinese President Xi in Osaka at the G20 meeting.
The Olentangy River peaks at 10.37 feet, almost flooding the TWHS Field House.
A magnitude 6.5 earthquake shakes southern California. It's epicenter is in the Mojave Desert.
A magnitude 7.1 earthquake strikes southern California near Ridgewood - about the same place as the previous day's quake.
Bitcoin runs up to $12,000 briefly.
Cycling: Longest bike ride. 47 miles, Olentangy Trail, South High Street, Alum Creek
Donald Trump sends a series of racist tweets telling female minority representatives to go home to their crime infested countries. The racist tweets cause an uproar.
Kelly is hired full time at HMS Healthcare.
The DOW peaks at 27,359.
At a rally in Greenville, NC, Trump's crowd chants "Send her back, send her back" in response to Trump's theme of minorities being sent back to the countries where they came from.
China's Tiangong-2 space station reenters over the Pacific. Unlike Tiangong-1, this reentry is planned and controlled.

A relentless heat wave, affecting 200 million people, grips the country from the central states to the East Coast, prompting cancellation of the New York City Triathlon and producing cracked and buckled roads in some Plains states. Some East Coast cities braced for temperatures in the triple digits.
Robert Mueller testifies before the House on his report on Russian interference in the 2016 election. He fails to make an impact and Democrats are dissapointed.

Boeing posts its largest-ever quarterly loss due to the spiraling cost of resolving issues with its 737 MAX and warns it may have to shut down production at it's Renton plant, which would affect 10,000 jobs.

President Trump pressures Ukrainian President Zelenskyy to investigate the Bidens in exchange for military aid. This phone call becomes the basis of a whistleblower complaint that leads to President Trump's impeachment.
The Fed cuts the funds rate 1/4 from 2.25 to 2, the first cut in 11 years. The DOW falls 400 points.

A mass shooting in an El Paso Walmart by a racist kills 20. A mass shooting in Dayton later that day kills 10. Both shooters are young white males wearing body armor with AK-47 style guns with high capacity clips.

The DOW plunges 767 points as China devalues its currency and announces it will no longer purchase American agricultural products. Late in the day, President Trump announces he is naming China a "currency manipulator".
Cycling: Longest bike ride. 47.0 miles, 3:59, 11.8 mph, 2,855 calories - Olentangy, South High Street, Alum Creek, Westerville
Hurricane Dorian, a strong catagory 5, makes a direct hit on Abaco island in the Bahamas. The slow moving storm completely destroys the island leaving hundreds dead and tens of thousands homeless.

Apple releases the iPhone 11, iPhone 11 Pro and iPhone 11 Pro Max. The iPhone Xr and iPhone 8 line remain for sale. They also release a new entry level iPad that supports Apple Pencil 1 and the Apple Watch 5 line featuring an "always on" display.
cycling: Third 40+ mile bike ride, 42.8 miles.
50,000 auto workers go on strike against General Motors.
Java 13 released.
iOS 13 released by Apple
iPad OS 13 released by Apple.

Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced the House would initiate a formal impeachment inquiry against President Trump, charging him with betraying his oath of office and the nation’s security by seeking to enlist a foreign power to tarnish a rival for his own political gain.

President Trump withdraws American troops in Syria to clear the way for a Turkish offensive against America's Kurdish allies. Many in the GOP are outraged as Kurds are slaughtered and ISIS regains a foothold.

Rudy Giuliani's Ukranian associates, Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman, are arrested for making illegal foreign campaign finance contributions to former Texas Rep.Pete Sessions in exchange for assistance in getting the Ukranian ambassador fired. Two days later Trump later denies that Giuliani is his personal attorney.
The UAW increases strike pay from $250 to $275 per week as the strike against GM continues.
Cycling: Longest bike ride. 50.2 miles, 4:46, 10.5 mph, 3,215 calories, Olentangy, South High Street, Alum Creek, Westerville, Sharon Woods
Cycling: Longest bike ride. 54.5 miles, 4:50, 11.2 mph, 3,581 calories, Alum Creek, Three Creeks Park, Alum Creek
The Campbell family starts a vacation to Titusville, FL.
Alex plays in the Symphonic Orchestra for the National Honor Band at the Gaylord Palms Resort in Orlando, FL.
The Campbell family returns to Columbus (at 4:30 am)

Record snowfall occurred across Ohio.
* Cincinnati 2.3" - old record 1.3" in 1894
* Dayton      2.3" - old record 2.0" in 1894.
* Columbus 2.1" - old record 0.5" in 1983.
Data from the first two Parker Solar Probe passes is released to the public.
Apple introduces the fifth generation MacBook Pro, featuring a magic keyboard, physical Esc key and separate fingerprint sensor.
The Artemis 1 Orion Capsule arrives at Plum Brook Station near Sandusky for vacuum chamber and space environmental testing.

A 6.4 magnitude earthquake ravaged Albania at an approximate depth of 20 kilometers. The tremor was felt in Tirana and in places as far away as Taranto and Belgrade while the most affected areas were the coastal city of Durrës and Kodër-Thumanë.
We move back to the 4th floor of the OCLC Kilgour Building.
